qas.question: Who is supported by civilian, scientific, and professional military advisors?

answers.text: The Ministers and Chiefs of the Defence Staff

qas.question: What is the Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Defence generally known as?
Where does the Permanent Secretary serve as the senior civil servant?
What is the role of the Permanent Secretary?

answers.text: to ensure the MoD operates effectively as a department of the government

plausible_answers.text: a number of civilian, scientific and professional military advisors

qas.question: What is another name for the Minister of the Defense?

plausible_answers.text: to ensure the MoD operates effectively as a department of the government

qas.question: What is the role of the Chief of Defence?
Where does the Minister of Defence serve as the senior civil servant?

plausible_answers.text: ensure the MoD operates effectively as a department of the government

qas.question: What does the Chief of Defense do?

context: <a0_0>The Ministers and Chiefs of the Defence Staff<a0_0/> are supported by <b4_0>a number of civilian, scientific and professional military advisors<b4_0/>. The Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Defence (generally known as <b5_0>the <a1_0>Permanent Secretary<b5_0/><a1_0/>) is the senior civil servant <b7_0>at the <a2_0>MoD<b7_0/><a2_0/>. His or her role is <a3_0><b6_0>to <b8_0>ensure the MoD operates effectively as a department of the government<b8_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/>.
